page.title: 19CROSSGATE_OWNER OCCUPIED.
page.content: {Crossgate}is an all grass dairy farm of 114 acres;50 are cut three times a year for silage to feed the Holstein dairy herd in winter.All heifer calves are reared for replacement,bull calves are sold for beef rearing.Milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board for approx 15p.a litre,retailed at 37p.Machinery consists of 3 tractors,1forage-box, 1 forage-harvester,mower,plough,slurry- forker,loading-shovel,harrows,chain- harrows & 2 trailers. The D'Aunceys arrived in England with {William the Conquerer}and were given land in Somerset which remained in the family until 1920.Mr. Dauncey's father tried Canada for 4 yrs.then returned to England and settled in Devon.Mr.H.J Dauncey bought{Crossgate}in 1959.With 2 sons he cares for stock,farms land & completes 6mthly.Agricultural Returns. Mrs.Dauncey does all other office work
